name: fruit
question: Imagininative
Investigative
Realistic
Analytical
desc: imagination - n. 1. The mental power of forming images of unreal or absent objects. 2. Such power used creatively. 3. Resourcefulness. --imaginative adj. -- imaginatively adv.
investigate - v. -gated, -gating. To make a systematic inquiry (into): examine deeply. --investigation n. --investigative adj. --investigator n.

realism n. 1. Concern with factucal truth and things as they really are: practicality. 2. Artistic representation intended as an unidealized portrayal of objective reality. --realist n. --realistic adj. -- realistically adv.

analysis n., pl. -ses 1. separation of an intellectual or substantial whole into its parts for individual study. 2. chem. a. Separation of a substance into its elements to determine their nature (qualitative analysis) or their proportions (quantitative analysis). b. A statement of the results of such study. 3. psychoanalysis --analyst n. --analytic, analytical adj.

name: intelligence
question: Linguistic
answers: You talk through problem, ask questions, and explain solutions.
You refer to things you’ve heard or read in your conversations.
You read books, magazines, newspapers, product labels.
You enjoy making puns, tongue-twisters, limericks.
You learn through listening: lecture, CDs, radios, podcasts.
You are good at debating and winning arguments.
You’re a good story teller and express yourself well verbally and in writing.
You like crosswords, Scrabble, other word puzzles.
You sometimes have to explain a word you have used.
In school, you preferred English, history, social studies.

name: intelligence
question: Bodily-Kinesthetic
answers: You don’t mind dancing and may even enjoy it.
You are known as a good ‘do-it-yourselfer’.
You enjoy thrilling rides at a theme park.
You prefer hands-on learning rather then reading a book or manual.
You enjoy rough-housing when playing with your children.
Your comprehension is increased when you can physically handle something.
When communicating, you use gestures and body language to get your point across.
You walk or pace when thinking problems or situations through.
In school, you preferred PE and shop/hands-on classes.

name: intelligence
question: Intrapersonal
answers: You work independently or often wish you could.
You like to spend quiet time reflecting on important issues in your life.
You keep a daily journal or log to record your innermost thoughts.
You have established your personal goals and a plan of action for achieving them.
You have a personal interest or hobby that you keep to yourself and don’t share.
The ideal vacation to you is an isolated mountain cabin or bungalow on the beach rather than a busy resort.
You like hiking or fishing alone. You are comfortable with yourself.
You are an independent thinker and can make up your own mind.
You have attended self-help seminars or read books to learn more about yourself.
You know your own strengths and weaknesses.

name: intelligence
question: Logical-Mathematical
answers: You prefer step-by-step and systematic approaches to problem solving.
When considering things people say and do, you look for logical flaws.
You consider yourself a numbers person and enjoy doing calculations.
It’s helpful to quantify or categorize things to understand their relevance.
You have a natural interest in new scientific discoveries and advances.
You are good at finding specific examples to support a perspective or point of view.
You love brainteasers and puzzles that tap into logical thinking skills.
You vacations follow a preplanned itinerary.
In school, math and science were your favorite subjects.

name: intelligence
question: Musical
answers: You can sing and carry a tune.
You remember melodies after hearing them a few times.
You play at least one musical instrument.
You prefer music in the background when working or studying.
You are often caught humming or whistling.
When you hear music, you tap in time.
You can’t imagine life without music.
You can identify different musical instruments.
You often listen to music at home and during your commute.
Jingles or movies soundtracks often pop into your head.

name: intelligence
question: Naturalist
answers: You could see yourself as a farmer or park ranger.
You can identify many different types of trees, flowers, and plants.
You keep up to date on health issues.
You consider conservation of resources and achieving sustainable growth important issues at our age.
When out walking, you notice animal tracks, nests, wildlife, and can read weather signs.
You are intrigued by psychology and human motivations and social issues.
You are interested in astronomical developments and the evolution of life in general.
You like to garden and can tell one plant from another.
You are interested in global environmental issues.

name: intelligence
question: Spatial
answers: You doodle when taking notes or thinking something through.
When reading, you prefer subject matter filled with illustrations.
You enjoy the arts: theater, film, art, music, etc.
You can visualize how things look from various perspectives.
At family gatherings or special events, you are often the one taking photos and capturing videos for posterity.
You support your position or point with drawings or diagrams.
You find visual games or puzzles appealing and enjoyable.
You are skilled at taking things apart and putting them back together.
You are an adept navigator and read maps well.
In school, you preferred arts and crafts classes and geometry to algebra.

name: intelligence
question: Interpersonal
answers: You enjoy and are effective at mentoring others.
Working with a group, team, or committee is preferable to working alone.
When solving a problem, you tend to seek advice and input from others rather than trying to solve it yourself.
Others tend to come to you when they need advice or a good listener.
When it comes to sports, you prefer team sports rather than individual sports.
You don’t hesitate to take the lead our show others how to accomplish something.
You are a good communicator and helpful in resolving disputes.
You enjoy games that require participation with others, such as board games.
You prefer to be at a party than at home watching television.

name: intelligence
question: Existential
answers: You always look at the big picture.
You enjoy exploring questions with no clear answer, such as the meaning of life.
You approach problems from multiple points of view.
You seek connections between what you are learning now and the larger world.
You often look to the future and consider how your actions will play out.
You can and do rely on intuition to make decisions.
You are religious or interested in the answers religion might provide.
You have literally contemplated the nature of the cosmos.
You are not afraid of the unknown.
You enjoy open discussion with other thinkers.
